title-group.article-title: Using Internet Relay Chat in Teaching Chinese

abstract.p: The aim of this project is to explore the feasibility of using Internet Relay Chat (IRC) to facilitate Chinese language teaching and learning. This article describes procedures for organizing and conducting chat sessions and discusses the benefits and problems of using IRC. It is argued that IRC promotes communication in the target language and that it enhances students' reading and writing skills. However, some general problems such as keyboarding skills as well as some special difficulties with typing Chinese characters exist. More research is still needed.

ref.mixed-citation: Zhuyin and Pinyin are two phonetic systems to represent Chinese pronuncia- tion. Zhuyin is a set of specially designed symbols. Some symbols represent con- sonants, for example, * J (b) and k (p), others represent vowels like Y (a), - (i) and < (u) or combination of vowels like -X (ao) and X (ou). The Pinyin system uses Romanized letters. The same Chinese word 'A' (person) can be represented as either '0 V (Zhuyin) or 'ren' (Pinyin). Zhuyin symbols are assigned to the computer keyboard. When one types a word using either Zhuyin or Pinyin, the computer program converts the word to Chinese characters.
